newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thais act against illegal Asian workers.
newsitem.headline: Thais act against illegal Asian workers.

text.p: Thai immigration officials said on Friday they had launched a crackdown against Bangladeshi, Burmese, Cambodian and Laotian workers entering the country illegally.
Spot checks at the airport on Bangladeshis arriving in the country led to the arrest on Thursday night of 67 of them holding fake visas, an immigration official told Reuters.
On Friday morning, immigration authorities rounded up nearly 400 Burmese, Cambodian and Laotian workers who had entered the country illegally, he added.
The official did not say what action would be taken against the 400 who were picked up.
The action follows complaints from Malaysia last week that Bangladeshi workers were using Thailand as a transit point for illegal entry into Malaysia, he added.
"Intead of deporting them (Bangladeshis) we decided to prosecute them on charges of falsifying documents as a deterrent," he said.
The charge carries a maximum penalty of five years' imprisonment.

The immigration official said the National Security Council had estimated that about 5,000 Bangladeshis, who had entered Thailand illegally, were hiding in the jungles along the southern Thai-Malaysian border.
